title: The Pentagon Could Use a Four-Star General on Top
sub_head: Give me a defense secretary mature and savvy enough to doubt the generals.
body:
Rep. Mike Gallagher omits the main points that augur in favor of retired generals serving as defense secretary (“No More Generals Atop the Pentagon,” op-ed, Dec. 21). If people richly experienced in dealing with crises, the endless funding trade-offs and the personal cost of conflict are ruled out, then we’re likely to get someone who is politically oriented, academically experienced and beholden to a party. I’ve seen enough of the dilettantes. Give me someone mature and savvy enough to doubt the generals, someone more loyal to the 20-year-olds than to his political sponsors.
Lloyd Austin worked for me or with me for nearly two years, and I know him to be a man of impeccable character with a razor-sharp intellect and a serene approach to crises. He is what America has been missing, so don’t allow the notional to preclude the necessary.
Lt. Gen. (ret.) Greg Newbold
United States Marine Corps
Flat Rock, N.C.
